item.title: Tattered and Bandaged, Russian POWs Describe Ukraine's Offensive
item.description: The first battles in Ukraine’s big offensive, aimed at retaking land in the country’s south and east occupied by Russia, are yielding a steady flow of Russian prisoners.

item.title: Global Tax Mess Awaits U.S. Companies, and Congress Isn't Helping
item.description: The consequences of an international minimum-tax agreement are about to be felt.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: What’s News: Business & Finance

item.title: For Estranged Dads, Father's Day Is a Painful Reminder
item.description: Divorce, cultural changes and communication problems can make it hard for men to repair their relationships with the children they love.

item.title: The Benefits of Getting to Know Your Future Self
item.description: Many of us feel little connection with the person we’ll be decades from now. That can lead to shortsighted behavior that hurts us in the long run.

item.title: Cutouts, Sheer Dresses, No Pants: How to Pull Off 'Naked Dressing'
item.description: Barely there, see-through and otherwise skimpy outfits are dominating runways and red carpets. But you needn’t show all to try the trend. Here, expert advice on how to wear “naked” clothes chicly—even to work.

item.title: No One Is Looking Forward to the 2024 Election
item.description: Donald Trump and President Biden appear headed for a repeat of 2020, and many voters are dreading the prospect.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Was Early in AI. Now Meta Is Trying to Catch Up.
item.description: CEO Mark Zuckerberg has invested for more than a decade in academic discoveries about AI, even making them open for others to view and use. Now Meta is behind in making consumer products like ChatGPT.

item.title: Pepper...and Salt
item.description: Pepper...and Salt

item.title: Died: Daniel Ellsberg, 92, military analyst who leaked the Pentagon Papers.
item.description: Died: Daniel Ellsberg, 92, military analyst who leaked the Pentagon Papers.

item.title: The Biden administration is grappling with how to identify artificial intelligence that poses a threat to national security, as the U.S. moves to curb investment in advanced technology companies in China.
item.description: The Biden administration is grappling with how to identify artificial intelligence that poses a threat to national security, as the U.S. moves to curb investment in advanced technology companies in China.

item.title: A jury found Robert Bowers guilty of dozens of federal hate crimes related to his killing of 11 people at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, the deadliest antisemitic attack on U.S. soil.
item.description: A jury found Robert Bowers guilty of dozens of federal hate crimes related to his killing of 11 people at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, the deadliest antisemitic attack on U.S. soil.

item.title: The Minneapolis Police routinely discriminate and use excessive force against residents, the Justice Department found in a sweeping civil-rights investigation launched after an officer's 2020 killing of George Floyd sparked a national outcry.
item.description: The Minneapolis Police routinely discriminate and use excessive force against residents, the Justice Department found in a sweeping civil-rights investigation launched after an officer’s 2020 killing of George Floyd sparked a national outcry.

item.title: Ukraine's ambitious offensive to take back Russian-occupied land is proving to be a hard slog against dense minefields, well-prepared defenses and Russia's superior air power. Meanwhile, African leaders on a visit to Kyiv urged Ukraine and Russia to start talks to end the war.
item.description: Ukraine’s ambitious offensive to take back Russian-occupied land is proving to be a hard slog against dense minefields, well-prepared defenses and Russia’s superior air power. Meanwhile, African leaders on a visit to Kyiv urged Ukraine and Russia to start talks to end the war.

item.title: Major stock indexes fell but ended with weekly gains. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow lost 0.4%, 0.7% and 0.3%, respectively, on Friday.
item.description: Major stock indexes fell but ended with weekly gains. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow lost 0.4%, 0.7% and 0.3%, respectively, on Friday.

item.title: UPS workers who are represented by the Teamsters voted to authorize a strike if contract negotiations with the company fail to yield a new agreement.
item.description: UPS workers who are represented by the Teamsters voted to authorize a strike if contract negotiations with the company fail to yield a new agreement.

item.title: The Commerce Department published an online-security rule, aiming to strengthen its legal hand against foreign-basedapps, including TikTok, that could threaten the U.S.
item.description: The Commerce Department published an online-security rule, aiming to strengthen its legal hand against foreign-based apps, including TikTok, that could threaten the U.S.

item.title: Micron Technology said it would invest about $600 million to expand production in the Chinese city of Xi'an, a move that comes about a month after Beijing blacklisted the memory-chip company.
item.description: Micron Technology said it would invest about $600 million to expand production in the Chinese city of Xi’an, a move that comes about a month after Beijing blacklisted the memory-chip company.

item.title: Intel plans to build a $4.6 billion semiconductor assembly and test facility in Poland, giving the country a coveted place in the chip giant's growing European production footprint.
item.description: Intel plans to build a $4.6 billion semiconductor assembly and test facility in Poland, giving the country a coveted place in the chip giant’s growing European production footprint.
